data.title: List of tattoo artists
data.text: Name Date Nationality Note 1968b. 1968 American Tattoo artist and painter based in Illinois, featured on TLC's Tattoo Wars. 1966b. 1966 American Chicago, Illinois based artist featured on TLC's LA Ink. 1985b. 1985 American Real name is Keith Scott McCurdy. Kari Barba b. 1960 American Current owner of tattoo shop in Long Beach, California, that has continuously operated since 1927 1959b. 1959 American b. 1967 American b. 1972 American Betty Broadbent 1909–1983 American Tattoo artist and most photographed tattooed lady of the 20th century b. 1987 German New York based tattoo artist 1872–1953 British Known as "King of Tattooists".[1] Tattooed royalty and The Great Omi.[2] Scott Campbell b. 1977 American New York-based tattoo artist b. 1970 Mexican American a.k.a. Mark Machado 1982b. 1982 American Artist at Vincent Castiglia Gallery & Custom Tattoo 1976b. 1976 Mexican Known as "The Vampire Woman" and "The Jaguar Woman".[3] Recognized by Guinness World Records as the most tattooed woman in the world, with 96% of her body covered.[4] August Coleman 1884–1973 American In 1918, he opened a tattoo parlor in Norfolk, Virginia, near the navy base there. Ben Corday 1875–1938 American Prolific tattoo flash artist 1964b. 1964 British Owner of Tattoo UK, UK based tattoo studio chain. Amund Dietzel 1891–1974 Norwegian American Early American tattoo artist, "Master of Milwaukee" 1967b. 1967 French Polynesian tattoo artist based in Tahiti, French Polynesia. 1970b. 1970 American Formerly based in New York City, now based in Florida. Featured on TLC's Miami Ink.[5] 1951b. 1951 American New Jersey-born artist known for his photorealism and large scale portraits. Julia Mage’au Gray b. 1973 Papua New Guinean Credited with revitalising women's traditional tattooing, such as veiqia from Fiji, in countries in Oceania. Jacci Gresham b. 1951 American Her shop, Aart Accent Tattoos & Body Piercing, is Louisiana's oldest continuous tattoo business. 1951b. 1951 American Known for her work in medical tattooing and permanent makeup. 1973 1973–2019 Japanese Florida based tattoo artist, featured on TLC's Miami Ink. 1945b. 1945 American Known as "the godfather of modern tattoo."[6] Hardy trained under Sailor Jerry and Japanese masters, Hardy is a noted proponent of the use of Japanese tattoo designs and techniques in American work. He founded Tattootime. New Zealand One of New Zealand's only female tā moko artists.[7] 1968b. 1968 American a.k.a. Henry Martinez Jr. Shanghai Kate Hellenbrand b. 1942 American Called "America's Tattoo Godmother" 1972b. 1972 American 1973b. 1973 American Based in New York City Martin Hildebrandt 1825–1890 German-American Early tattoo artist in New York City 1919–2010 German Horihide 1929–2017 Japanese Horiyasu b. 1953 Japanese One of the most respected contemporary tattooists in Japan 1946b. 1946 Japanese 1981b. 1981 American Has been a guest artist on LA Ink several times. Judge on Paramount's Ink Master (2022). 1947–1984 American 1972b. 1972 Israeli Co-star of Miami Ink. Main judge on Ink Master Season 14 American Jessie Knight 1904–1992 British First prominent female tattoo artist in the UK b. 1957 German Student of Horst Streckenbach, conceptual artist 1963b. 1963 American 1972b. 1972 Mexican a.k.a. Jeronimo Lopez Ramirez b. 1947 American a.k.a. Beverly Bean. Based in Seattle, Washington. 1973b. 1973 New Zealand Based in London. 1993b. 1993 Swedish Sutherland Macdonald 1860–1942 British The first tattooist in Britain with an identifiable premises open to the public. 1957b. 1957 American b. 1987 American Tattoo artist based in Grand Junction, CO, featured on Ink Master & Ink Master: Angels. b. 1967 American b. 1963 British 1989b. 1989 British Born Grace Walker 1973b. 1973 American Featured on TLC's Miami Ink.[5] 1852–1908 American Patented the first electric tattoo machine 1973b. 1917 Filipino The oldest Filipino tattooist and Kalinga's last mambabatok. 1971b. 1971 American b. 1979 Chinese Known for her Chinese Art and Calligraphy pieces 1949/1950–1999 Samoan Samoan master tattooist 1969b. 1969 American 1971b. 1971 American 1989b. 1989 British 1959b. 1959 American Known for original and freehand, tattooing as well as painting, illustration and cartooning. Currently owner/operator of Charm City Tattoo, Baltimore, Maryland. 1932–2001 American Tom Riley 1870–? British Tattoo artist in the 19th century Franklin Paul Rogers 1905–1990 American Designed tattoo machines American Known for his "black and gray" work. Owns/tattoos at Goodtime Charlie’s Tattooland in Anaheim, California. 1973b. 1973 American One of the artists on the first season of LA Ink. 1911–1973 American a.k.a. Norman Keith Collins. 1952b. 1952 Dutch a.k.a. Hanky Panky. The Amsterdam Tattoo Museum showcases his tattoo collection, the largest in the world. Jonathan Shaw b. 1953 American Founded a tattoo shop in New York City in 1976 b. 1993 American Based in San Francisco, California. 1943–2007 British 1909–1993 American a.k.a. Phil Andros and Phil Sparrow;[8] tattoo artist and writer from Ohio, later based in California. Horst Streckenbach 1929–2001 German a.k.a. "Tattoo Samy" 1972b. 1972 American Notable for his work on celebrities including Angelina Jolie and Drew Barrymore and his line of porcelain dinnerware with Ink Dish. b. 1962 American Known for his "black and gray" portraits 1982b. 1982 Mexican Featured on TLC series Miami Ink and LA Ink.
